text.0: o worthy of oblation lord of prospering powers assume thy robes.
text.2: sit ever to be chosen as our priest most youthful through our hymns.
text.3: o agni through our heavenly word.
text.4: for here a father for his son kinsman for kinsman worshippeth.
text.5: and friend choiceworthy for his friend.
text.6: here let the foedestroyers sit varuṇa mitra aryaman.
text.7: like men upon our sacred grass.
text.8: o ancient herald be thou glad in this our rite and fellowship.
text.9: hearken thou well to these our songs.
text.10: whateer in this perpetual course we sacrifice to god and god.
text.11: that gift is offered up in thee.
text.12: may he be our dear household lord priest pleasant and choiceworthy may.
text.13: we with bright fires be dear to him.
text.14: the gods adored with brilliant fires have granted precious wealth to us.
text.15: so with bright fires we pray to thee.
text.16: and o immortal one so may the eulogies of mortal men.
text.17: belong to us and thee alike.
text.18: with all thy fires o agni find pleasure in this our sacrifice.
text.19: and this our speech o son of strength.
